meanings.definition: The ability of a material to be sintered.
meanings.sent1: The sinterability of this metal allows it to be easily fused together.
meanings.sent2: The ceramic's sinterability is crucial for creating strong pottery.
meanings.sent3: The sinterability of the clay made it a perfect choice for the sculptor's project.
meanings.sent4: Her determination had a sinterability that welded her team together like molten metal.
meanings.sent5: The sinterability of the glue was so strong that the pieces stuck together instantly.

meanings.definition: The quality of being capable of undergoing sintering.
meanings.sent1: The high sinterability of the alloy made it ideal for the manufacturing process.
meanings.sent2: Engineers test the sinterability of different materials to find the most suitable ones.
meanings.sent3: The sinterability of the chocolate in the sun resulted in a deliciously melted mess.
meanings.sent4: His patience had a sinterability that allowed him to endure the toughest challenges.
meanings.sent5: The sinterability of the fabric made it easy to sew and shape into beautiful garments.
